diagnosis.final_diagnosis: autosomal dominant hypocalcemia due to activating mutation of the calcium-sensing receptor gene
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with hypocalcemia at 3 weeks of age, and genetic analysis revealed a novel missense mutation (L727Q) in the CASR gene. This mutation was associated with severe hypocalcemia and hypercalciuria, leading to successful treatment with recombinant human PTH(1â€“34). The patient's symptoms improved, urinary calcium excretion decreased significantly, and no serious hypocalcemic episodes occurred during PTH treatment.
